descrip: Hackers For Dummies helps you hack into a hacker's mindset and take security precautions to help you avoid a hack attack. It outlines computer hacker tricks and techniques you can use to assess the security of your own information systems, find security vulnerabilities, and fix them before malicious and criminal hackers can exploit them.

How Computers Work shows you how chips, software, memory, and hardware work using detailed four-color drawings. An interactive game-like CD-ROM takes you directly inside your computer. This book is completely updated and revised to include the latest technology developments.

titulo: Code: The Hidden Language of Computer Hardware and Software
descrip: What do flashlights, black cats, and seesaws have to do with computers? In CODE, they show us the ingenious ways we manipulate language and invent new means of communicating with each other. And through CODE, we see how this ingenuity and our very human compulsion to communicate have driven the technological innovations of the past two centuries.
Perl is a language for getting your job done.

titulo: Singularity Hypotheses: A Scientific and Philosophical Assessment
descrip: Singularity Hypotheses: A Scientific and Philosophical Assessment offers authoritative, jargon-free essays and critical commentaries on accelerating technological progress and the notion of technological singularity. It focuses on conjectures about the intelligence explosion, transhumanism, and whole brain emulation.

Effective and well-implemented version control is a necessity for successful web projects, whether large or small. With this book you’ll learn how to master the world of distributed version workflow, use the distributed features of Git to the full, and extend Git to meet your every need.

titulo: The Mythical Man-Month: Essays on Software Engineering
descrip: Classic text on the human side of software engineering, containing essays on the management of software teams, projections about how computer languages and tools will evolve, and philosophical speculation.

titulo: Blockchain Basics: A Non-Technical Introduction in 25 Steps

descrip: Física universitaria es una colección de tres volúmenes que cumple con los requisitos de alcance y secuencia para los cursos de física de dos y tres semestres con base en el cálculo. El Volumen 1 abarca la mecánica, el sonido, las oscilaciones y las ondas.
